meanings.definition: A narrow street or alley, especially one running between or behind buildings.
meanings.sent1: The children played hide-and-seek in the quiet bylane.
meanings.sent2: I took a shortcut through the bylane to get to the market.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased a mouse down the bylane, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: In the maze of life, sometimes we find ourselves lost in a bylane of memories.
meanings.sent5: The bylane was so narrow that only one car could pass through at a time.

meanings.sent1: We decided to bylane our way to the park to avoid the traffic.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys bylaning through the countryside on her bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The tourists bylaned through the old town, discovering hidden gems along the way.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts bylaned back to the days of his youth, filled with nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The river bylanes its way through the valleys, carving a path of beauty.
